properties.name: The William P. Nicolson House
properties.description: 821 Piedmont Ave. in north Atlanta, Tel. 404-872-9290

properties.name: Adair Park Historic District
properties.description: The Adair Park Historic District is roughly bounded by Metropolitan Pkwy., Lexington Ave., Norfolk Southern Railroad and Shelton Ave. The houses in the district are private residences and are not open to the public.

properties.name: Ansley Park Historic District
properties.description: The Ansley Park Historic District is located in mid-town Atlanta and west of Piedmont Park, between Piedmont Ave. and Peachtree St. The houses in the district are private residences and are not open to the public, but there is more information and a virtual tour available through the Ansley Park Civic Association. Guided walking tours are also offered by The Atlanta Preservation Center.

properties.name: Atlanta University Center District
properties.description: The Atlanta University Center Historic District is roughly bordered by the transit right-of-way, Northside Drive, Walnut, Fair, Roach, West End Dr., and Euralee and Chestnut Streets. The grounds of the University are open to the public.

properties.name: Brookhaven Historic District
properties.description: Brookhaven Historic District is located in NE Atlanta, and roughly bounded by Peachtree Rd. on the south and east, Peachtree Dunwoody Rd. on the west, and Windsor Pkwy. on the north. The houses in the district are private residences and are not open to the public.

properties.name: Brookwood Hills Historic District
properties.description: Brookwood Hills Historic District, east of Peachtree Road, is roughly bounded by Huntington Road to the south and east, Northwood Avenue and Montclair Drive on the west, and Brighton Road to the north. The houses in the district are private residences and are not open to the public.

properties.name: Cabbagetown District
properties.description: The Cabbagetown District is bounded by Oakland Cemetery, Boulevard and Pearl Streets, Memorial Drive, and the Georgia Railroad tracks. The houses in the district are private residences and are not open to the public.

properties.name: Castleberry Hill Historic District
properties.description: Castleberry Hill Historic District is roughly bounded by Nelson Street, Southern and Central of Georgia Railroad, McDaniel, Peters and Walker Streets. The shops within the district are open during normal business hours.

properties.name: Druid Hills Historic District
properties.description: Druid Hills is roughly bounded by the Fulton County line on the west, Briarcliff Road to the northwest, just over the Emory Road line on the north and following the southside of Emory Road. The boundary cuts south and juts east around the Fernbank Forest and Recreational Center, then cuts east and south along tracks of the Seaboard Coast Line. South it is bordered by North Aveue and the Atlanta City Boundary. The houses in the district are private residences and are not open to the public, but there is more information available through the Druid Hills Civic Association. Walking tours are available at 10:00 am on Saturdays only from March to November. Twilight tours are also available.

properties.name: Emory University District
properties.description: The Emory University District is roughly bounded by N. Decatur Road, Oxford Road, Dickey Drive, Kilgo Circle, and Asbury Drive. The campus, comprising nine different colleges, is generally open to the public; tours are not offered regularly but can be arranged through the admission offices. The Michael C. Carlos Museum at 571 Kilgo Street is located on Emory University campus and houses a permanent collection of over 15,000 objects, spanning nearly 9,000 years from prehistoric cultures to the 20th century.

properties.name: Fairlie-Poplar Historic District
properties.description: The Fairlie-Poplar Historic District is roughly bounded by Marietta, Peachtree, Luckie and Cone Streets. Many of the businesses in the district are open to the public during normal businesses hours.

properties.name: Fox Theatre Historic District
properties.description: Within the Fox Theatre Historic District, the Georgian Terrace Hotel is located at 659 Peachtree Street in downtown Atlanta and is open during normal business hours; visit the hotel's website at www.thegeorgianterrace.com for more information. The Ponce de Leon Apartments at 79 Ponce de Leon Ave. are private residences and not open to the public. However, the shops in the lower levels of the building are open during normal business hours. The district also includes the Fox Theatre.

properties.name: Garden Hills Historic District
properties.description: Garden Hills Historic District is located in Northeast Atlanta and is roughly bounded by Delmont, Brentwood, and North Hills Drives, Piedmont, East Wesley and Peachtree Roads. The houses in the district are private residences and are not open to the public.

properties.name: Georgia Institute of Technology Historic District
properties.description: The Georgia Institute of Technology Historic District is roughly bounded by Fowler, Third, and Cherry sts. and North Ave. in north Atlanta. Campus tours are offered Monday-Friday at 11:00am and 2:00pm, except holidays. Call 404-894-1939 or visit the Georgia Tech website for more information.

properties.name: Grant Park Historic District
properties.description: The Grant Park Historic District is bounded by Glenwood and Atlanta Avenues and Kelly and Eloise Streets. Walking tours are available at 10:00 am on Sundays from March-November.

properties.name: Hotel Row Historic District
properties.description: Hotel Row includes 205 through 235 Mitchell Streets (odd numbers only). The first floor shops are open during normal business hours.

properties.name: Howell Station Historic District
properties.description: The Howell Station Historic District is generally bounded by West Marietta, Rice, Baylor and Herndon Streets, Niles Circle and Longley Avenue. The houses in the district are private residences and are not open to the public.

properties.name: The Inman Park-Moreland Historic District
properties.description: The Inman Park-Moreland Historic District is bordered on the north and northwest around Seminole, Cleburne, and North Highway Avenues. The houses in the district are private residences and are not open to the public, but the commercial shops are open to the public during normal business hours.

properties.name: Mozley Park Historic District
properties.description: Mozley Park Historic District is roughly bounded by Westview Drive, West Lake Avenue, Seaboard Coast Line Railroad tracks, and Rockmark and Martin Luther King, Jr. Drives. The houses in the district are private residences and are not open to the public. Mozley Park at 1565 Martin Luther King, Jr., Dr. is open 6:00am to 11:00pm daily.

properties.name: Stone Mountain Historic District
properties.description: Stone Mountain Historic District is located in east central DeKalb County, 10 miles east of Atlanta on route 10. The district is roughly bounded by Stone Mountain Cemetery, Stone Mountain Memorial Park, Lucile St., CSX Railroad, VFW Dr., and the city limits. It contains several commercial shops which are open to the public during normal business hours, and many private residences which are not open to the public. Stone Mountain Park is not within the historic district, but is located adjacent to the town.

properties.name: Sweet Auburn Historic District
properties.description: Sweet Auburn Historic District is located along Auburn Avenue, generally between Courtland Street and I-75/85 in downtown Atlanta. Walking tour maps are available through the Atlanta Convention and Visitors Bureau, 404-222-6688.

properties.name: Underground Atlanta Historic District
properties.description: Underground Atlanta, a shopping and entertainment district, is open to the public during normal business hours.

properties.name: Washington Park Historic District
properties.description: The Washington Park Historic District is generally bounded by Ashby Street, Martin Luther King Jr. Drive, Simpson Street and Ashby Terrace. The houses in the district are private residences and are not open to the public.

properties.name: West End Historic District
properties.description: West End Historic District, in the southwest section of Atlanta, is roughly bounded by I-20 to the north, Lee Street to the east, White Street to the south, and Langhorn Street to the west. The Hammonds House, located at 503 Peeples Street, is open to the public Tuesday-Friday from 10:00am to 6:00pm; Saturday-Sunday from 1:00pm to 5:00pm. Call 404-752-8730 for more information.
